content.text: write this as a single block with distinct formatting
write this as a single block with distinct formatting

message.content:
```
### Warning: Active Development

- The project is currently in active development.  
- The API may change at any time without prior notice.  
- Monitor updates or check versions if using this project in applications.

### Bug Reports & Feature Requests

- Bug reports are welcome.  
- Feature requests can be submitted as needed.
```

reasoning.text:
Alright, so the user is asking me to rewrite some text that's currently split into two parts—one about the active development warning and another about submitting bug reports and feature requests. They want it in a restructured text format but as a single block.

First, I need to understand what they're looking for. The initial response was split into two code blocks: one with bullet points for the warning and another for the feature requests. Now, they want this combined into one block without using markdown, just plain text.

I should make sure each part is clearly separated within the same block. Maybe I can use lines or spaces to distinguish between the warning and the feature requests section. 

Thinking about formatting, perhaps adding line breaks after each main heading would help. So starting with "### Warning: Active Development" followed by a bullet list, then moving on to "### Bug Reports & Feature Requests" and listing those under it.

I also need to maintain consistency in numbering the points—using either bullets or numbered lists for readability. Bullet points might be better here since they match the initial format but are easier to read in text form.

Finally, I'll compile all this into a single block without any markdown, just plain text with clear section headings and bullet points under each.
